title: Apple's iPad Keynote
heading: Apple × Procreate: "Let Loose" Keynote
description: Apple collaborated with Procreate to announce a new line of iPads and the Apple Pencil Pro at their May 2024 keynote event.

content.title: A Historic Moment
text: In a rare honor, Apple invited Procreate to participate in their spring 'Let Loose' keynote event. James Cuda, our CEO, and Nikko Lockertson, a brilliant artist, demonstrated how Procreate Dreams can harness the power of the new Apple Pencil Pro, showcasing innovative features like squeeze gestures and rotation controls for animation.

This unprecedented opportunity wasn't just about demonstrating our latest innovations—it was Apple's public acceptance that we've almost been adopted into their ecosystem and that we are central to the core experience of the iPad.

content.title: Consolidating Our Brand
text: As we were preparing to be publicly seen on the world stage alongside Apple, we undertook a comprehensive refresh of our digital presence. Our homepage and product pages at the time were an amalgamation of many years of hard work announcing multiple products, releases, and campaigns. Now it was time to consolidate our output and present a cohesive, unified brand to the world.
Our team handled three key initiatives:
1. Redesigns of our homepage and product pages to clearly communicate our brand architecture.
2. A new "Who We Are" page to define Procreate as the parent brand.
3. A new "Careers" page to attract world-class talent interested in shaping the future of creative tools.

content.title: Homepage Redesign
text: Our homepage was my first task. It needed to evolve from being a collection of callouts and announcements into a clear representation of our brand architecture and an intuitive customer journey.

The customer journey can be simplified down to three steps: learn about our products, learn how to use them, and learn who we are–all of which are communicated in the new navigation: "Products", "Learning", and "Company". This journey is also reflected clearly in our new footer redesign.
I redesigned our approach above the fold to communicate our product hierarchy and to emphasize our core competitive advantage: our creative tools are only ever a one-time payment.

content.alt: new site hero, above the fold, clear product/brand hierarchy
content.caption: Above the fold, we communicate our products clearly: illustration and animation tools. One-time payment. Simple.

images.alt: below the fold, our other products

content.caption: Below the fold, we show Procreate Pocket, our third product, and an isolated block for announcements. The footer reinforces our brand architecture.

text: The new product hero sections were also re-designed to be cohesive so that each product is viewed as part of a broader family. The design and the art direction underscores boththe core features of each product and what unique purpose they serve.

content.title: Who We Are
text: Our next step was telling our story as Procreate—not just as individual products. This meant creating a narrative that connects the delightful user experience and powerful capabilities of our tools with our core belief that art is for everyone.

The new "Who We Are" page introduces visitors to our values, our journey, and our vision for the future of digital creativity. We're creators ourselves, and we're building a company that only ships products that we love.

content.title: Careers
text: To accommodate our ambitious roadmap, we needed a careers page that would attract exceptional talent who share our passion for creativity and innovation. We're not all just smiles and laughing faces. We've come from all of over the world to work on something very special, and we challenge ourselves everyday to make the creative experience as easy and as unhindered as possible.
My designs reflect our belief that we don't need to sell our culture with benefits, perks, and a smiling veneer. We let our work speak for itself.

content.title: On the world stage
text: Our surprise appearance generated waves of excitement throughout the creative community. The keynote drove over 50k views to our refreshed website during event week, while the technical demonstration reinforced our position as pioneers in digital creativity tools.
